poem:
**Detour**

Our bus promised Paris, awoke us with London dusk shoes,
9am became fractured dawns,
departure reworked its wool to cloak the gate,
tickets muttered misdirection.
Wheels turned Vienna, Brussels, Rome—yet Paris not alighted.
Stories shift, said threads embroider,
lines detour but may still adorn,
and not-quite-Paris can still reign a borrowed glory.
